armchair.description: Now that Felix is 21, he is getting reckless. He climbs furniture and jumps with abandon.
armchair.title: Armchair

garden1.description: Blowing bubbles is one of Felix's very favorite activities. He's not very good at it, and always ends up with bubble liquid all over his face.
garden1.title: Garden 1

garden2.description: Felix and Babushka do a bit of gardening. Felix is being a good little helper, dutifully carrying the bucket of soil.
garden2.title: Garden 2

garden3.description: We had some really hot weather this week, so we spent a lot of time in the garden. Felix's favorite part was that he was allowed to be completely naked.
garden3.title: Garden 3

garden4.description: Felix peed in the potty for the first time this week! When you are not wearing a diaper, it is much easier to plop down on an instant notice.
garden4.title: Garden 4

playground1.description: Another well-spent afternoon at our local playground.
playground1.title: Playground 1

playground2.description: Felix insists on having his snack in the dining car of the playgound's choo-choo train.
playground2.title: Playground 2

playground3.description: Lucie prefers sitting in the no-crumb car.
playground3.title: Playground 3

pool1.description: Babushka came to our weekly swimming lesson. Look at Felix's perfect leg action!
pool1.title: Pool 1

pool2.description: Anna, the little girl who stays at Sylvie's sometimes, just joined our swimming class. Here she is, with her mom Chris.
pool2.title: Pool 2

restaurant.description: Family outing to a Senegalese restaurant, where a Brazilian friend of Mikek's was singing. Our evening baby-sitting arrangements fell through, so we took the little one along, and it was a success. Perhaps we'll start taking him out to dinner more often!
restaurant.title: Restaurant

description:
On his 21 month birthday, Felix peed in the potty for the first time... big boy stuff! He's done it once at Syvie's and once at home. But we're still a long way from being housebroken.

His incoming molars are painful, which has given him a short fuse most of the week. Many days any little thing set off a tantrum, but they were usually short. He particularly hates getting dressed, because he wants to continue his potty-training.

We thought we'd give a retrospective of his most-used vocabulary in honor of him turning 21:

  • yeah, no, more/encore/[fingers tapping palm], up, down: the basics.
  • choo-train, car, plane, caco (bike), boat/bateau: Felix loves his vehicles. Bateau also means the ocean or the beach.
  • foo(d), cookie, (ba)nana, pomme (apple,or any round fruit), r(ais)in, pain (bread), chee(se), jus (juice), [hands rubbing] (water), bo(ttle)/[counting down motion]: Felix loves his food.
  • Papa, Mommy, Sylvie: Felix loves his people
  • dog/doggie/georgie, chat/cat, [clicking noise] (horse), ack ack ack (bird), du(ck), turtle, (ele)phant/[hand to nose], (dol)fin, fish/[mouth opening and closing], ssssssssss (snake), fly (any insect), frog/[toungue darting in and out],[touching neck] (giraffe): Felix loves his animals
  • [palms closing and opening] (book), lala (TV), pho(ne), [hand to ear] (noise, music), key, [clicking noise] (clock), nounou (teddy bear), bébé, main (hand), shoe, [hand tapping head] (hat, or shower, depending on context), bain (bath), [finger rubbing gum] (toothbrush), pipi, caca, outside/dehors, ball, bubbles, fleur (flower), dodo (sleep), bye-bye: Felix has a wide range of interests
  • cassé: broken, in French. This is a new word. Felix very much notices when one of his toys is broken. A banana with a piece broken off is also cassé
  • mine: this one is not so endearing. Felix has always been possessive, but it has taken a turn for the worse. Evan came over to our house one afternoon, and Felix screamed the whole time, yelling "mine" at anything that Evan touched. He is fine with sharing on neutral ground, but home is sacred.
  • [fist rubbing eye] crying. Whenever Felix spots another child crying, he wants to know why.
title: September 14
